Package tage.nodeControllers

Class RotationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • tage.NodeController
      • tage.nodeControllers.RotationController
  • public class RotationController
extends NodeController
    A RotationController is a node controller that, when enabled, causes any object it is attached to to rotate in place around the tilt axis specified.
    Author:
    Scott Gordon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      RotationController()
      Creates a rotation controller with vertical axis, and speed=1.0.
      RotationController​(Engine e, org.joml.Vector3f axis, float speed)
      Creates a rotation controller with rotation axis and speed as specified.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void apply​(GameObject go)
      This is called automatically by the RenderSystem (via SceneGraph) once per frame during display().
      void setSpeed​(float s)
      sets the rotation speed when the controller is enabled

      • Methods inherited from class tage.NodeController

        addTarget, disable, enable, getElapsedTime, getElapsedTimeTotal, isEnabled, toggle

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed​(float s)
        sets the rotation speed when the controller is enabled

      • apply

        public void apply​(GameObject go)
        This is called automatically by the RenderSystem (via SceneGraph) once per frame during display(). It is for engine use and should not be called by the application.
        Specified by:
        apply in class NodeController
